display.description: Registers a subscription
Unregisters a subscription
Lists operations available on Microsoft.KeyVault resource provider
Check the result of a long run operation
Checks that a key vault name is valid and is not in use

display.operation: Delete virtual network or subnets notification
display.description: Notifies Microsoft.KeyVault that a virtual network or subnet is being deleted
View the properties of a key vault
Creates a new key vault or updates the properties of an existing key vault. Certain properties may require more permissions.
Deletes a key vault
Enables access to secrets in a key vault when deploying Azure resources
Updates an existing access policy by merging or replacing, or adds a new access policy to the key vault.
Gets the available logs for a key vault
Gets the diagnostic setting for the resource
Creates or updates the diagnostic setting for the resource
Get the available private link resources for the specified instance of Key Vault

display.operation: Approve or reject a Private Endpoint connection
display.description: Approve or reject a connection to a Private Endpoint resource of Microsoft.Network provider

display.operation: View state of Private Endpoint Connection Proxy
display.description: View the state of a connection proxy to a Private Endpoint resource of Microsoft.Network provider

display.operation: Change state of Private Endpoint Connection Proxy
display.description: Change the state of a connection proxy to a Private Endpoint resource of Microsoft.Network provider

display.operation: Delete a Private Endpoint Connection Proxy
display.description: Delete a connection proxy to a Private Endpoint resource of Microsoft.Network provider

display.operation: Validate a Private Endpoint Connection Proxy
display.description: Validate a connection proxy to a Private Endpoint resource of Microsoft.Network provider

display.operation: View state of Private Endpoint connection
display.description: View the state of a connection to a Private Endpoint resource of Microsoft.Network provider

display.operation: Change state of Private Endpoint connection
display.description: Change the state of a connection to a Private Endpoint resource of Microsoft.Network provider
Delete a connection to a Private Endpoint resource of Microsoft.Network provider
View the properties of soft deleted key vaults
View the properties of a soft deleted key vault
Purge a soft deleted key vault
List the keys in a specified vault, or read the current version of a specified key.

Creates the first version of a new key if it does not exist. If it already exists, then the existing key is returned without any modification. This API does not create subsequent versions, and does not update existing keys.
List the versions of a specified key, or read the specified version of a key.
Delete Certificate Issuer
Read Certificate Issuer
Write Certificate Issuer
Manage Certificate Contact
Deletes a certificate. All versions are deleted.
List certificates in a specified key vault, or get information about a certificate.
Creates the backup file of a certificate. The file can used to restore the certificate in a Key Vault of same subscription. Restrictions may apply.
Purges a certificate, making it unrecoverable.
Updates the specified attributes associated with the given certificate.
Creates a new certificate. If the certificate does not exist, the first version is created. Otherwise, a new version is created.

Imports an existing valid certificate containing a private key. The certificate to be imported can be in either PFX or PEM format. If the certificate does not exist in Key Vault, the first version is created with specified content. Otherwise, a new version is created with specified content.

Recovers the deleted certificate. The operation performs the reversal of the Delete operation. The operation is applicable in vaults enabled for soft-delete, and must be issued during the retention interval.
Restores a certificate and all its versions from a backup file generated by Key Vault.

display.operation: Read Key Properties and Public Key
display.description: List keys in the specified vault, or read properties and public material of a key. For asymmetric keys, this operation exposes public key and includes ability to perform public key algorithms such as encrypt and verify signature. Private keys and symmetric keys are never exposed.
Updates the specified attributes associated with the given key.
Creates a new key. If the key does not exist, the first version is created. Otherwise, a new version is created with the specified value.
Imports an externally created key. If the key does not exist, the first version is created with the imported material. Otherwise, a new version is created with the imported material.
Recovers the deleted key. The operation performs the reversal of the Delete operation. The operation is applicable in vaults enabled for soft-delete, and must be issued during the retention interval.
Restores a key and all its versions from a backup file generated by Key Vault.
Deletes a key. All versions are deleted.
Creates the backup file of a key. The file can used to restore the key in a Key Vault of same subscription. Restrictions may apply.
Purges a key, making it unrecoverable.
Encrypts plaintext with a key. Note that if the key is asymmetric, this operation can be performed by principals with read access.
Decrypts ciphertext with a key.
Wraps a symmetric key with a Key Vault key. Note that if the Key Vault key is asymmetric, this operation can be performed by principals with read access.
Unwraps a symmetric key with a Key Vault key.
Signs a message digest (hash) with a key.
Verifies the signature of a message digest (hash) with a key. Note that if the key is asymmetric, this operation can be performed by principals with read access.
Release a key using public part of KEK from attestation token.
Creates a new version of an existing key (with the same parameters).
Retrieves the rotation policy of a given key.
Updates the rotation policy of a given key.
View the properties of a secret, but not its value.
Creates a new secret or updates the value of an existing secret.
Deletes a secret. All versions are deleted.
Creates the backup file of a secret. The file can used to restore the secret in a Key Vault of same subscription. Restrictions may apply.
Purges a secret, making it unrecoverable.
Updates the specified attributes associated with the given secret.

Recovers the deleted secret. The operation performs the reversal of the Delete operation. The operation is applicable in vaults enabled for soft-delete, and must be issued during the retention interval.
Restores a secret and all its versions from a backup file generated by Key Vault.
List or view the properties of a secret, but not its value.
Gets the value of a secret.
Sets the value of a secret. If the secret does not exist, the first version is created. Otherwise, a new version is created with the specified value.
Read definition of managed storage accounts.
Creates or updates the definition of a managed storage account.
Delete the definition of a managed storage account.
Creates a backup file of the definition of a managed storage account and its SAS (Shared Access Signature).

display.operation: Purge Managed Storage Account or SAS
display.description: Purge the soft-deleted definition of a managed storage account or SAS (Shared Access Signature).

display.operation: Regenerate Key of Managed Storage Account
display.description: Regenerate the access key of a managed storage account.

display.operation: Recover Managed Storage Account or SAS
display.description: Recover the soft-deleted definition of a managed storage account or SAS (Shared Access Signature).
Restores the definition of a managed storage account and its SAS (Shared Access Signature) from a backup file generated by Key Vault.

display.operation: Set SAS Definition for Managed Storage Account
display.description: Creates or updates the SAS (Shared Access Signature) definition for a managed storage account.

display.operation: Delete SAS Definition for Managed Storage Account
display.description: Delete the SAS (Shared Access Signature) definition for a managed storage account.

display.operation: Read SAS Definition for Managed Storage Account
display.description: Read the SAS (Shared Access Signature) definition for a managed storage account.
View the properties of an HSM pool
Create a new HSM pool of update the properties of an existing HSM pool
Delete an HSM pool
Join a key vault to an HSM pool

display.description: Notifies Microsoft.KeyVault that an EventGrid Subscription for Key Vault is being deleted
